intro: Erythroxylum cienaguense, commonly known as the Cienaga copal tree, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical in shape, and have a smooth, glossy surface. The tree is also valued for its copal resin, which has been used traditionally for various purposes.
